mythological-monsters.name: Mermaid
mythological-monsters.origin: Greek, Syrian, Babylonian and Polynesian mythology
mythological-monsters.description: This alluring fish human rules the underwater world, its endeavors range from collecting thingamabobs to being a menace and causing floods, shipwrecks, storms and drownings. They are also said to be able to transform into 'human form' while dry on land.

mythological-monsters.name: Banshee
mythological-monsters.description: A female spirit who heralds the death of a family member by letting lose a blood curdling screech.

mythological-monsters.name: Unicorn
mythological-monsters.origin: Ancient Mesopotamian, Indian, Greek and Chinese mythology
mythological-monsters.description: An elegant and majestic horse-like creature with a single horn (often confused witha dunce hat) sticking upright on its head. A unicorn's horn is said to also contain healing properties.

mythological-monsters.name: Oni
mythological-monsters.description: A giant man eating monster with a face as red as a tomato. They are often known to carry heavy iron club-like weapon and violently punish evildoers. In other words, 'omae wa mou shindeiru'.

mythological-monsters.name: Minotaur
mythological-monsters.description: With the body of a man and the head/tail of a bull, it's safe to assume they will never have a bad hair day. This ferocious beast is known to reside in the center of a labrynth or maze created by King Minos advised by the oracle Delhi to hold the Minotaur at bay.

mythological-monsters.name: Gorgon
mythological-monsters.description: This enticing snake haired madonna turns men into stone with just a glance, teaching people not to be seduced by stand alone beauty.

mythological-monsters.name: Griffin
mythological-monsters.description: A bald headed eagle with large wings and the body of a lion, both powerful and majestic. This creature is know to be the protector of valuable items.

mythological-monsters.name: Vampire
mythological-monsters.description: An undead immortal creature, who's characterized by sharp fangs, pale skin, and the urge and need to live off of the blood of the living. Can be stopped by a measley wooden stake or a little bit of Vitamin D.
